alert.note: Alert for Charles (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:24PM EDT until July 29 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR THE SOUTH CENTRAL DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA...SOUTH CENTRAL ANNE ARUNDEL...NORTHWESTERN CALVERT...SOUTHERN PRINCE GEORGES...NORTHERN CHARLES...SOUTHEASTERN ARLINGTON...SOUTHEASTERN FAIRFAX...AND SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE WILLIAM COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF ALEXANDRIA... At 524 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Friendly to near Fort Hunt to Lorton to near Montclair, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Alexandria, Waldorf, Dale City, Clinton, Springfield, Fort Washington, Fort Hunt, Groveton, Huntington, La Plata, Fort Belvoir, Woodbridge, National Harbor, Andrews Air Force Base, Lake Ridge, Burke, Lincolnia, Montclair and Camp Springs. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
